reviews.title: Great location, very good service
reviews.text: We stayed at Tivoli Jardim for a weekend in April. I had chosen this hotel for the location and it was perfect. We could walk to the square of Restauradores, and there were plenty of buses and a metro station to take us everywhere else, including to the airport, on the main avenue.

reviews.title: Very nice hotel.
reviews.text: Having stayed here many times in the past we were most disappointed - the recent refurbishment has made the hotel modern to the point of being stark and cold. The room was miniscule - maybe we were unlucky with that. The room was also fvery cold and did not warm up even by the next morning leaving the bathroom so cold you had to be extremely brave to shed clothes and take a shower. What a shame as this used to be a great place to stay - we will no be booking this one again.

reviews.title: Smart hotel in a good position and the pool was a big plus

We spent two nights there at the end of November and enjoyed our experience very much - kind and helpful staff, super comfortable bed and pillows, a fun and trendy good restaurant/bar, great location for touring the city, etc.

reviews.text: Review - Hotel Tivoli Jardim

reviews.title: Good Hotel, Great Location
reviews.text: This hotel in central Lisbon was the first stop of several on a family vacation through Portugal. Hotel Tivoli Jardim is the little sister hotel of the larger and grander Hotel Tivoli Lisboa next door.  The hotel was clean and modern, and the staff was pleasant and helpful.  Standard rooms are modern, nicely decorated, but a little small by American standards.  The lobby area is also very small.  With the exception of two clamshell hanging chairs located beside the reception desk, there was no place to sit and relax.  However, one flight up is a small lounge/bar with additional seating.  Our stay included breakfast, which offered a nice selection of fruit, cereal, yogurt, bacon, scrambled eggs, sausage and pastry.  Guests staying at Hotel Tivoli Jardim are welcomed to use the facilities at Tivoli Lisboa next door, including a pretty outdoor pool, but with a somewhat inconvenient hike up several levels of steps, but well worth the walk.  This lovely, inviting pool is round, surrounded by trees and greenery and includes bar service, and is a popular place to relax for guests from both hotels and, as such, lounge chairs are scarce during the mid-day hours.  Consequently, it was difficult at times to find a vacant chair or lounger.  Otherwise, it's a lovely hotel oasis.  For guests who don't mind small rooms and a less than inviting lobby, the hotel is a fine stopover for a short stay in Lisbon.

reviews.title: Ants all over the Dining Room
reviews.text: Had seven nights here at the end of July. The balcony rooms were "a must" for us and those at the Tivoli Jardim are usable (table and two chairs) and in the shade in the hot afternoons. Our room was clean and comfortable though we had to live out of suitcases for the week, as there are no drawers in the room (at least we didn't find any) and there is limited hanging space.

reviews.title: A Prazer
reviews.text: The room is equipped with a Nespresso coffee maker and it's a 1E charge per cup (it's an extension to the mini-bar). It will make hot water too.

reviews.title: Great location and very nice hotel
reviews.text: The staff are friendly and helpful, our breakfast was included and was of a high standard with a good range of fresh food on offer.

description: Tivoli Jardim reopens totally remodeled with new bright and contemporary decoration where the lines are based on fresh and natural themes. This oasis in the centre of Lisbon meets the most demanding of tastes with new rooms and exceptional facilities for both business and pleasure. The new colours of this welcoming 4 star hotel, are warm and comfortable but with a balance which creates soothing and restful settings.
